newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gilts up, shrug off bond auction impact.
newsitem.headline: Indian gilts up, shrug off bond auction impact.

text.p: Indian government securities moved up in mid-morning trade Wednesday, recovering from losses late Tuesday after a bond auction was announced, dealers said.
They said prices fell Tuesday in deals for next-day value after the government's late-evening announcement of a 50 billion rupee auction of four-year bonds for July 28.
"Market players were a bit worried yesterday because of the size of the auction," said a dealer at a state-run bank. "But sentiment is bullish again as call money is stable today."
Call money was quoted 3.75-4.25 percent in latest deals against Tuesday's close of 4.0 percent.
In latest deals, the 11.83 percent 2003 stock recovered to 101.25 rupees after dropping to 101.10 late on Tuesday. The 12.59 percent 2004 rallied to 104.40 from 103.90, dealers said.
